Package gw.api.financials

Class CheckUtil

java.lang.Object
gw.api.financials.CheckUtil
public class CheckUtil extends Object
Provides static methods for working with checks throughout the ClaimCenter user interface.
Author:
cgross

  • Constructor Details

    • CheckUtil

      public CheckUtil()

  • Method Details

    • findDuplicates

      public static IQueryBeanResult<Check> findDuplicates(Check check, Check checkBeingCloned)
      Searches for and returns a list of checks that are possible duplicates of the given check.
      Parameters:
      check - the check to compare against when searching for duplicates
      checkBeingCloned - the check being cloned to produce a new check (if any), which has led to this method being called. Providing a value for this argument allows the check being cloned to be ignored when searching for dupes, since we would expect the new clone to be a dupe of its progenitor anyway.
      Returns:
      query result containing checks that are potential duplicates

    • saveRecurringCheckSet

      public static void saveRecurringCheckSet(CheckSet checkSet)
      Performs some pre-save processing and tests on the supplied CheckSet, including calling out to the Transaction pre-setup rules, and then tests whether the CheckSet requires approval. If so, the CheckSet is submitted for approval. Since this method requires the CheckSet to be associated with a recurrence it is really only useful in the context of the ChangeCheckRecurrence.pcf screen.
      Parameters:
      checkSet - the CheckSet to save. It must be associated with a check recurrence.

    • validateEnteredAmounts

      public static void validateEnteredAmounts(Check[] checks)
      Tests the gross amount of each check to ensure that it's positive. If a primary check is found that has a non-positive amount then an error message is displayed (via a UserDisplayableException). The error message's content is defined by the DisplayKey 'Java.Financials.CheckWizard.Error.NewPaymentProducesNonPositivePortionAmounts'
      Parameters:
      checks - the array of Checks whose amounts should be tested. Only checks that are of type 'Primary' will be tested.

    • transferCheck

      public static void transferCheck(Check newCheck, Check oldCheck, Location currentLocation)
      Handles the final step of transferring a check, once a new claim has been chosen/set for newCheck by calling newCheck.updateCheckForTransfer(). After that call and before calling this method, a new ReserveLine on the target claim can be chosen/set for each payment of newCheck.

      The non-null currentLocation parameter and its bundle are committed at the end of this method. If the newCheck has a final payment, and there is a CloseValidationException trying to close the Exposure or Claim, the commit and transfer still succeed and then an EntityValidationException is thrown to display the validation messages in a worksheet.

      See also {Check#prepareForCommitForTransfer( oldCheck )} for use in Gosu outside the UI.

      Parameters:
      newCheck - the new copy of the original check, already associated with the new claim
      oldCheck - the old check that is being transferred
      currentLocation - the current Pebbles location, typically the CheckTransfer.pcf page

    • canPay

      public static AbilityToPayResult canPay(Claim claim, Exposure exposure, Location location)
      Validates the indicated claim (and optionally exposure) at the 'Ability to Pay' level. Persists the resulting change in validation level for the claim / exposure (if any) to the database.
      Parameters:
      claim - The claim to test for ability to pay - can only be NULL if 'exposure' parameter is not NULL
      exposure - The exposure to test for ability to pay - can only be NULL if 'claim' parameter is not NULL
      location - The current location
      Returns:
      if validation fails, returns an AbilityToPayResult object that encapsulates the validation errors, else returns NULL

    • displayAbilityToPayValidationErrors

      public static void displayAbilityToPayValidationErrors(AbilityToPayResult result, Location location)
      Handles displaying the error messages encapsulated in an AbilityToPayResult object in the validation worksheet. If the 'result' parameter is NULL, this method does nothing.
      Parameters:
      result - the AbilityToPayResult object whose encapsulated error messages should be displayed - can be NULL.
      location - the current location
